trans-unit.target: Replying to comments

trans-unit.target: Sorting

trans-unit.target: Voting

trans-unit.target: Moderation

trans-unit.source: Spam protection

trans-unit.source: Miscellaneous
trans-unit.target: Miscellaneous

trans-unit.source: Comment anchor prefix: Every comment gets an own anchor which contains the uid of the comment. In the default case the anchor will look something like that: #comment1337.
trans-unit.target: Comment anchor prefix: Every comment gets an own anchor which contains the uid of the comment. In the default case the anchor will look something like that: #comment1337.

trans-unit.source: Show comment anchor name: This anchor will appear in front of the comment numbering.
trans-unit.target: Show comment anchor name: This anchor will appear in front of the comment numbering.

trans-unit.source: Write comment anchor name: This anchor will appear in front of the comment form.
trans-unit.target: Write comment anchor name: This anchor will appear in front of the comment form.

trans-unit.source: Successful anchor name: This is the anchor of the flash message which notifies the user that his comment has been submitted successfully.
trans-unit.target: Successful anchor name: This is the anchor of the flash message which notifies the user that his comment has been submitted successfully.

trans-unit.source: Custom messages anchor name: This anchor is part of index action and marks the flash message container to show customMessages, like "You can't vote for your own comment."
trans-unit.target: Custom messages anchor name: This anchor is part of index action and marks the flash message container to show customMessages, like "You can't vote for your own comment."

trans-unit.source: Show Gravatar image: Enables or disables the usage of gravatar images
trans-unit.target: Show Gravatar image: Enables or disables the usage of gravatar images

trans-unit.source: Gravatar image size: Size (in pixel) of gravatar images
trans-unit.target: Gravatar image size: Size (in pixel) of gravatar images

trans-unit.source: Gravatar Default image: This option specifies the default image for e-mail addresses without a gravatar
trans-unit.target: Gravatar Default image: This option specifies the default image for e-mail addresses without a gravatar

trans-unit.source: Use entry uid: Enables or disables the usage of entryUid
trans-unit.target: Use entry uid: Enables or disables the usage of entryUid

trans-unit.source: Entry uid: GET Parameter configuration of entry (e.g. news "GP:tx_news_pi1|news")
trans-unit.target: Entry uid: GET Parameter configuration of entry (e.g. news "GP:tx_news_pi1|news")

trans-unit.source: Enable replies to comments: Enables or disables the reply link and adds a hidden field to new comment form with uid of parent comment. If this option is activated the next one should be activated, too.
trans-unit.target: Enable replies to comments: Enables or disables the reply link and adds a hidden field to new comment form with uid of parent comment. If this option is activated the next one should be activated, too.

trans-unit.source: Show replies to comments: Enables or disables the display of already existing replies to comments.
trans-unit.target: Show replies to comments: Enables or disables the display of already existing replies to comments.

trans-unit.source: Count replies: If true, the placeholder {commentCount} will also count replies on comments. Otherwise just comments (no replies) will get counted.
trans-unit.target: Count replies: If true, the placeholder {commentCount} will also count replies on comments. Otherwise just comments (no replies) will get counted.

trans-unit.source: Invert comment sorting: Per default oldest comments are displayed first. If this option is true, the order of comments get inverted (newest comments first).
trans-unit.target: Invert comment sorting: Per default oldest comments are displayed first. If this option is true, the order of comments get inverted (newest comments first).

trans-unit.source: Invert reply sorting: See invertCommentSorting. Affects replies of comments instead of comments itself.
trans-unit.target: Invert reply sorting: See invertCommentSorting. Affects replies of comments instead of comments itself.

trans-unit.source: Enable comment votes: Enables or disables the voting controls for comments.
trans-unit.target: Enable comment votes: Enables or disables the voting controls for comments.

trans-unit.source: Enable reply votes: Enables or disables the voting controls for replies.
trans-unit.target: Enable reply votes: Enables or disables the voting controls for replies.

trans-unit.source: Enable voting: If disabled votes are visible but users may not vote for comments/replies. This is useful if you want to restrict possibility to vote for eg. logged in users but show the votings.
trans-unit.target: Enable voting: If disabled votes are visible but users may not vote for comments/replies. This is useful if you want to restrict possibility to vote for eg. logged in users but show the votings.

trans-unit.source: Hide vote buttons: If enabled the voting buttons are not visible. Caution: The voting functionality itself is still enabled.
trans-unit.target: Hide vote buttons: If enabled the voting buttons are not visible. Caution: The voting functionality itself is still enabled.

trans-unit.source: Ignore voting for own comments: If enabled users are not allowed to vote for their own comments/replies.
trans-unit.target: Ignore voting for own comments: If enabled users are not allowed to vote for their own comments/replies.

trans-unit.source: Moderate new comments: If this option is enabled, comments are not automatically visible. A back end user has to activate them first.
trans-unit.target: Moderate new comments: If this option is enabled, comments are not automatically visible. A back end user has to activate them first.

trans-unit.source: Send mail on new comments to: One or more e-mail addresses who will be informed every time a new comment has been submitted. Separate multiple recipients using a comma or leave empty to disable e-mail notifications.
trans-unit.target: Send mail on new comments to: One or more e-mail addresses who will be informed every time a new comment has been submitted. Separate multiple recipients using a comma or leave empty to disable e-mail notifications.

trans-unit.source: Send mail template: Defines the path to the Fluid template which should be used for notification e-mails
trans-unit.target: Send mail template: Defines the path to the Fluid template which should be used for notification e-mails

trans-unit.source: Send mail mime type: Defines the MIME-type of the e-mail body. Please note that changes made here also need to be regarded in the appropriate template.
trans-unit.target: Send mail mime type: Defines the MIME-type of the e-mail body. Please note that changes made here also need to be regarded in the appropriate template.

trans-unit.source: Sender address: Sender's mail address when pw_comments sends out mails.
trans-unit.target: Sender address: Sender's mail address when pw_comments sends out mails.

trans-unit.source: Sender name (optional): Name to display in mail clients, instead of mail address.
trans-unit.target: Sender name (optional): Name to display in mail clients, instead of mail address.

trans-unit.source: Send mail to author after submit: If this option is enabled, the author receives a mail after each comment he/she has written.
trans-unit.target: Send mail to author after submit: If this option is enabled, the author receives a mail after each comment he/she has written.

trans-unit.source: After submit mail template: Defines the path to the Fluid template which should be used for the e-mail to comment author.
trans-unit.target: After submit mail template: Defines the path to the Fluid template which should be used for the e-mail to comment author.

trans-unit.source: Send mail to author after publish: If this option is enabled, the author receives a mail after a comment he/she has written has been published. This option requires activated "moderateNewComments".
trans-unit.target: Send mail to author after publish: If this option is enabled, the author receives a mail after a comment he/she has written has been published. This option requires activated "moderateNewComments".

trans-unit.source: After publish mail template: Defines the path to the Fluid template which should be used for the e-mail to comment author.
trans-unit.target: After publish mail template: Defines the path to the Fluid template which should be used for the e-mail to comment author.

trans-unit.source: Sitename used in mails: When this option is set, it replaces the getHostname() output, used in mail subject.
trans-unit.target: Sitename used in mails: When this option is set, it replaces the getHostname() output, used in mail subject.

trans-unit.source: Seconds between two comments: Defines the number of seconds an user has to wait before they may post another comment (includes all pages)
trans-unit.target: Seconds between two comments: Defines the number of seconds an user has to wait before they may post another comment (includes all pages)

trans-unit.source: Link URLs in comments: If activated this option recognises and links domains.
trans-unit.target: Link URLs in comments: If activated this option recognises and links domains.

trans-unit.source: Use bad words list: Enables or disables the usage of bad word list. This option just checks the entered comment message.
trans-unit.target: Use bad words list: Enables or disables the usage of bad word list. This option just checks the entered comment message.

trans-unit.source: Use bad words list on username: If enabled performs bad words check on entered username. This option may be activated seperately from useBadWordsList option.
trans-unit.target: Use bad words list on username: If enabled performs bad words check on entered username. This option may be activated seperately from useBadWordsList option.

trans-unit.source: Use bad words list on mail addresses: Same like option useBadWordsListOnUsername, just for the entered email address.
trans-unit.target: Use bad words list on mail addresses: Same like option useBadWordsListOnUsername, just for the entered email address.

trans-unit.source: Path to bad word list: Defines the path a bad word list containing regular expressions (one in each line).
trans-unit.target: Path to bad word list: Defines the path a bad word list containing regular expressions (one in each line).

trans-unit.source: Hidden field - spam protection: If enabled an additional hidden field will be added to the comment form. If this field is filled (for example by a bot) the comment will not be saved.
trans-unit.target: Hidden field - spam protection: If enabled an additional hidden field will be added to the comment form. If this field is filled (for example by a bot) the comment will not be saved.

trans-unit.source: Hidden field name: Field name of the hidden field (type="input")
trans-unit.target: Hidden field name: Field name of the hidden field (type="input")

trans-unit.source: Hidden field CSS class: CSS class for hiding the field
trans-unit.target: Hidden field CSS class: CSS class for hiding the field

trans-unit.source: Absolute format fallback for relative dates: The dates of comments will be shown as relative dates (for example "2 hours ago"). After a longer period of time, the view helper switches to an absolute date. This setting controlls the output of this absolute date.
trans-unit.target: Absolute format fallback for relative dates: The dates of comments will be shown as relative dates (for example "2 hours ago"). After a longer period of time, the view helper switches to an absolute date. This setting controlls the output of this absolute date.

trans-unit.source: Show avatar: If enabled an avatar image is displayed for each comment.
trans-unit.target: Show avatar: If enabled an avatar image is displayed for each comment.

trans-unit.source: Require accepted terms (to post a new comment)
trans-unit.target: Require accepted terms (to post a new comment)

trans-unit.source: Enable rating for comments
trans-unit.target: Enable rating for comments

trans-unit.source: Typolink parameters to terms (in string, next to checkbox to click)
trans-unit.target: Typolink parameters to terms (in string, next to checkbox to click)
